answers.answer: Ceylon cinnamon (not the inexpensive cassia type commonly sold as cinnamon in food stores and supermarkets) is an insulin transporter, increasesinsulin sensitivity and provides anti-oxidizing benefits---J Am Coll Nutr. 2001 Aug;20(4):327-36.--"A hydroxychalcone derived from cinnamon functions as a mimetic for insulin in 3T3-L1 adipocytes."--Lipids Health Dis. 2017 Jun 12;16(1):113. doi: 10.1186/s12944-017-0504-8.--"Effect of oral cinnamon intervention on metabolic profile and body composition of Asian Indians with metabolic syndrome: a randomized double -blind control trial."---Diabetes Obes Metab. 2007 Nov;9(6):895-901.---"Effects of short-term cinnamon ingestion on in vivo glucose tolerance"Cheers,Niko
